p: The Obsoletus complex is a monophyletic group. In Italy, it is composed almost exclusively by two species, Culicoides obsoletus and Culicoides scoticus, although a third species, Culicoides montanus, is rarely recorded. This study aimed to investigate the vector competence of different Italian populations of Culicoides imicola and C. obsoletus/scoticus to some BTV strains responsible for recent incursions in the Mediterranean basin and Europe after artificial oral feeding. Four BTV strains (BTV-4 ITA 2014, BTV-2 2001, BTV-4 MOR, BTV-8 2006) were selected based on their ability to spread to one or two episystems.
